meanings.definition: The condition of having no petals.
meanings.sent1: The apetaly of the flower made it look unique in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the apetaly of various plant species.
meanings.sent3: The florist joked that the flower with apetaly must be camera shy.
meanings.sent4: In a field of colorful blooms, the apetaly of the white flower stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: Children were fascinated by the apetaly of the strange flower, asking many questions.

meanings.definition: The absence of petals on a flower.
meanings.sent1: The apetaly of the rose surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent2: The botanist noted the apetaly of the daisy in his research.
meanings.sent3: The bouquet looked incomplete with the apetaly of the main flower.
meanings.sent4: The garden seemed eerie with the apetaly of the once vibrant flowers.
meanings.sent5: Visitors were puzzled by the apetaly of the exotic plant in the conservatory.
